website_summaries.verdict: The Epson SureColor P800, which can print to a wide variety of paper sizes (including rolls with an optional adapter), is an excellent photo printer for pros and hobbyists alike.
pros: Can print on many different types and sizes of paper
Multiple high-quality ink tanks produce deeper blacks and saturated colors
cons: Paper roll add-on comes without a cutter
Wastes some ink when switching between matte black and glossy papers and back again

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old A4 inkjet and wanted a printer to produce good quality photo prints that also copied and scanned and the XP-8500 fitted the bill. I use Fotospeed Cotton Etching 305 paper on Epson A1 printer with a custom profile and the results are outstanding. Using the same paper on the XP-8500, again with a custom profile from Fotospeed (FOC if you buy paper from them) produces excellent results. For 90-odd quid this printer is superb. Yes, Epson inks cost but if you want quality prints this works.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mallett

customer_reviews.title: Cost Of The Cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Having just started printing photos in A3 size I Thought I would get a printer that would be a workhorse as well as a hobbyhorse. The XP960 fits the bill perfectly, it does all the regular tasks with ease and prints stunning quality images without changing the print settings to high quality settings. Just make sure you use a good quality photo paper. Remember - you buy cheap you will get cheap results. One other thing check around for replacement cartridges there are plenty of cheap alternatives to buying Epson O.E. and the results are just as good
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J.

customer_reviews.title: A Magnificent Beast!
customer_reviews.text: Epson printers just get easier and easier to set up, I normally run mine down to the ground before replacing with a newer version. This setup was an absolute breeze, I'm hopeless with computers yet this took next to no time at all. Printing is fast enough for a domestic device and on colour glossy paper the results are the best yet by far. I honestly cannot find a negative term to use in this rushed review, it literally almost worked straight out of the box. A fail to understand the gripes and the one star reviews relating to this product, it shines! Not to mention exceptional value it offers for the hard earned cash. BRILLIANT!
customer_reviews.author: The Prof.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: Had the printer for nearly 2 months now. Superb results so far, have used plain paper, glossy and lustre photo paper and various fine art papers, all with excellent results. Loading paper in the front Manual Tray was a bit hit and miss originally until I got the hang of it. Used it to replace my 7/8 year old Epson 3800 Pro printer, same price as I paid then, but even better results. Colour control screen is much better than the old mono screen and it can do much more.
customer_reviews.author: Glynne L. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Agree with all positive reviews. Compact, light printer - fits perfectly on my desk next to my iMac. Easy to install and set up - I had no problems at all with wireless setup both on my iMac and MacBook Air. Beware however, the printer comes with 6 ink cartridges in the box so you don't need to order the Printer and Ink pack UNLESS you want a spare ink pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this printer and it's working quite nicely. It took about 30-40 minutes to install and update all the firmware. It's a bit smaller than my previous Canon printer, so that's quite pleasing. I wasn't aware that it came with ink, so I bought the bundle that comes with an ink multipack, which I'm sure will come in handy later. However, for £82 it's a solid printer that prints very quickly. Another nice feature is that a tray will pop out to deliver your printed goods! Would recommend to those looking for a good printer but don't need something for professional photos, or anything that requires a HUGE amount of detail.
customer_reviews.author: WrenL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: What a brilliant printer, I had a brother which I loved but it was 8 years old and I wanted a wireless one, this is great easy to set up love the two trays, one for A4 and one for photographic paper, love the fact that the tray pops out automatically with your prints. The display can be moved so it's easy to see, so easy to print off your phone too, quicker than printers in the shops. There is a lot of tape on it when you get it so make sure you take it off, follow all the instructions on the cd and it's simple, the inks are expensive but you can get compatible ones.
customer_reviews.author: Xenaspal

customer_reviews.title: New epson 8500 colour printer 15years on.6
customer_reviews.text: My previous epson printer 750 I bought some 15 years ago and it served me well. so it was not difficult to choose epson again when the print mechanism finally failed. The new machine arrived well packed, well within the advertised time. 15 years of development certainly show with ease of set up and quality of print. Judging by my older colour prints it appears even the inks are better. Whatever, l am well pleased with the new one. Whats more it is less than half the price of the old one! Would seriously recommend.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Picture perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Always had Epson. Then tried Canon; oh dear! Noisy, awkward, limiting. Went back to Epson. Great! Quiet, efficient, easy and logical to use. Well designed and nicely featured. Very economical on the ink. Fits just right on my home office desk. Software just right. What's not to like? Only drawback is the very expensive inks. If Epson brought the price of their inks down to a reasonable level, they would sell more.
customer_reviews.author: large

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Printer, Excellent results with original Epson Ink.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one as my Canon Photo printer, 2 years old has somehow lost its print quality even with new original Canon ink. Very pleased with Photo results from Epson but when using non Epson ink, the printer reminds you that the ink is not original and no guarantee that results will be any good. Fine but don't need a constant reminder. Results are quite satisfactory with non original ink but for best results, yes Epson ink is visibly better.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha1

customer_reviews.title: An easy printer to use.
customer_reviews.text: Over all I like this printer. My other Epson printer died on me,had it quite a few years, it did me well. The Epson Expression XP8500 is similar but up dated with a touch screen and automatic opening and closing of the paper tray/s. And it has wi fi. Which so far I've not used. The touch screen is informative,tells me the amount of ink left,paper(type of) etc. The scanning and copying is very easy,just like my old printer,it does a good job of it. I would recomend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: P. Busancano

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is acceptable...just. If you are wanting photo-quality print outs, forget this printer. The colours only resemble the original picture no matter how much fiddling you do with the menu options. If you leave the printer unused for a few days and then come back to use it...!!!???!!! You have to clean the nozzles and perform all of the house-keeping rituals before it will consent to print. After a month of use, my printer decided it was getting too old to print anything more than faded copies irrespective of the house-keeping rituals, menu options and so on. A complete waste of money. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Townie

customer_reviews.title: A very good printer at a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: A very good, if at times complicated printer. Assembly was easy, controls understandable and the print quality excellent. Combined with Epson Photo Quality paper the 8500 produces really, really good prints...highly recommended. Printing of text is quick and good. Scanner scans, copier copies, say no more. Ink consumption is very pleasing; having 6 tanks is so much of a relief. A small minus; I'm still struggling to load one tray with print quality paper and the other with photo quality, both A4 size, but this could just be me.
customer_reviews.author: mike samuels

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an A3/A4 printer to replace an older Epson. This was delivered within 24 hours, installation and setting it up to work via WiFi was easy and worked without a hitch. Printing quality is excellent (I print my underwater pictures). Scanning is quick and easy but you have the option to exercise advanced control if you wish. If you are looking for a decent A3/A4 printer I recommend this one. It also acts as a copier. Very good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: GM2

customer_reviews.title: Ink cartridges expensive!
customer_reviews.text: After having this printer I’d never get an Epson printer again. The first one broke down after 4 weeks. Epson wanted me to drive 2 hours across London to drop it off and have it fixed and then collect it at a later date which I thought entirely unsatisfactory! ( After having it for such a short time.) Luckily Amazon replaced it for me. Now I’m having problems with the second one. It churns through the ink and won’t accept any other supposedly compatible ink cartridges except overpriced Epson ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic desktop printer which will not take up much space
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Compact, reliable, wireless printing from IPhone and good price. They do make their money on the ink though. Epson app enables me to check printer status and ink levels easily. Due to its compact size it doesn’t hold a huge amount of paper but double sided printing is impressive for the footprint it takes up on the desk. Ink is easy to replace with step by step instructions on touch screen. It does take 7 colours though. Impressed by the speed at which it prints even double sided.
customer_reviews.author: Adamhill56

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this printer which was easy to set up with good clear instructions. The printing is fast and the quality very good. The scanner and copier are similarly good. The dual side printing is a great bonus too. It has had the odd funny moment where it refuses to print or take paper from the correct feed and both printer and computer have to be re-set, but I suspect the driver not the printer. It will take non-Epson ink too although you have to confirm every time.
customer_reviews.author: P R LAVIES

customer_reviews.title: A good value A3 quality printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to have a better printer for colour prints and A3 capability.So far I am very happy with it, it eas straight foward to install on my Mac operating system and my phone and ipda can pick it up dine, I still have my much cheaper HP printer that Inow use for everyday black and white stuff. I was pleased to find that there are some much cheaper ink cartridge alternatives on Amazon that semm to work well and have good reviews. I must admit I had none of the set issues that some other reviewers had, that includes updating the printer operating system software to the latest available
customer_reviews.author: Clifton.D

customer_reviews.title: Works well and almost silent use
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer, However you do have to print at least one page a week or the jets get clogged as a nozzle check will show, I set this up tested it then left it standing for over a mth requiring 3x head cleaning before the nozzle check uncloged the heads.... keep it in weekly use and all should be fine. Other than that the printer is very handy and i love the double sided print (my first printer that does this) and the envelope print is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: NOT SO BRILLIANT! EXPENSIVE CARTRIDGES
customer_reviews.text: I had an XP 605 before this. Given the price difference I expected a huge difference between that and this in terms of quality but it turned out to be almost the same. Touch screen has made my life massively easier though. I have just learnt that its cartridge (even for non-genuine) cost fortune! at least £35.00 Two sets of cartridges worth printer itself. Stay away from this printer if you want cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Oldies2004

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Canon
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Epson after purchasing a Canon TS5051 printer, which gave very poor photo print, The Expression has six ink tanks rather than the two of Canon, and gives the best photo prints I ever had. It proved easy to set up and is compact, easy to use, and the back up from Epson first class. I can recommend the printer in all respects although as it is new reliability is unknown. So far could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bull

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer does the job very well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Printer does the job very well. Be warned the original replacement cartridges are incredibly expensive, in fact more than the cost of the printer, How do they justify the Price ?. they are a few alternatives that are cheaper but still costly. I would have given this product 5 stars if it was not for the cost of original replacement cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: movietel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Photo Printer especially for Black & Whites Images
customer_reviews.text: I have had issues with a few other printers recently where I want to be able to print photographs in black and white as well as colour. This printer prints really well and the blacks and whites are very good. The printer has two cassettes which is useful where you wish to print plain paper copies and another for photo quality prints. The printer is also smart about knowing what paper you are using unlike the Canon alternative which needed to be set for every change. So far, this printer is very pleasing and I am really happy with it after a few weeks of good use. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mb1971

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Once you get passed the time consuming process of installing the numerous required drivers on all your devices (to give some context, you need one for wireless printing, one for scanning, an event manager for general connectivity, a driver for each phone or tablet, and several more depending on what you want to use the printer for) you will find that this printer is very easy to use, with an intuitive touch screen and truly excellent print quality for the money. The photo printing is especially excellent and we've stopped using services like Snapfish since getting this printer as there is no discernible difference in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: AIHurrell

customer_reviews.title: Good versitile printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good versitile printer which can deal with heavy weight paper and card up to A3. Print speed for A4 documents is good, print quality is excellent. Photo printing lacks a little depth in colour but still very acceptable allthe way up to A3. I've had this a few months now and the only negative comment I could make is the A4 paper tray is very cheap and flimsey feeling, but it hasn't broken yet. Good printer, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Neil W

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I've ever bought! Printing anything seems to become a huge pantomime, with lights and icons flashing and bleeping all over the place. The inks run out in the blink of any eye and cost a fortune to replace, plus the printer has now decided I cannot print in black only. It's on the scrap heap and I've gone back to a good old reliable HP.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Banany

customer_reviews.title: not impressed
customer_reviews.text: if I had not put cartridges in and tried it would have been sent back my old epson 640 printed better than this one and it was starting to leave black ink everywhere scanner lid very flimsy and cheap looking controls dont seem to improve the printing so total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Skye1

customer_reviews.title: absolute crap
customer_reviews.text: The print quality once set is fantastic, but the actual operation of he printer is abysmal. cant use tray 1 as the printer takes the paper and just pulls it straight through goe straight to jail without passing go. tray 2 tells me it is out of paper when its full and then if it does decide there is paper there it doe's not pull it through and then registers a paper jam. there is only one word for this printer and it begins with s and ends in t. My advice don't bother, spend your money on something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Darc-Frank

customer_reviews.title: the best printer ever
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer for making art prints on textured inkjet paper, it's really excellent. Prints everything from 3.5x5inch up to A3 for me. Scanner is decent too and the epson app I use has done the job so far. There is a thick paper setting accessible through the printer screen which has been life changing.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Great printer... for 2 years before it died!
customer_reviews.text: I have an error message today which - according to the Epson website - basically means that the printer has reached the end of its life! I bought it two years ago. I have been so nice to it! I’ve only ever used the (super expensive) genuine Epson inks. Admittedly, I’ve used it a lot... every day... but still, 2 years? I now have the cost of a stash of very expensive new cartridges and a new (non Epson I’m afraid) printer to swallow. Not impressed Epson, sorry 😐
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint - fiddly paper\media handling
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a small footprint, but you pay the price in the way you have to mess around with the paper trays. in particular the CD\DVD tray is a real pain. It is a separate tray that you have to,carefully load in the right position. My previous Epson Printer PX730WD was a joy in comparison and I am going to try and locate a replacement The prints from this printer are good. The ink cartridges are expensive, the compatible ones at 25% the cost of genuine Epson, are stil typically twice the price of older Epson printers
customer_reviews.author: AmazonToday

customer_reviews.title: Can unit be replaced
customer_reviews.text: Epson XP 8500 ordered 20/08/2019 delivered 28/08 but due to problems on setup. Epson Support contacted 29/08 (3 x emails) and responded to problems with 23 emails between this date and 01/11/2019, the latter suggesting that Epson Spain should resolve the problems. The XP 858 was bought from Amazon as new and a repair is totally unacceptable when a replacement should be made as the printer is faulty as evidenced by the failure of Epson Support to remedy the faults. Norman C.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel in Spain

customer_reviews.title: Connection problems EVERY TIME,
customer_reviews.text: None stop connection issues. Every time I wanted to print either from computer or tablet, I would have to turn the printer on, off, then on again, otherwise it wouldn't connect.Time after time my daughter reset the settings, but still no good, and as for the automatic power knot when you request to print something, never once did it happen, if I didn't turn the power on manually, it would not connect, saying " can't find a printer". I have only ever owned Epsom printers, and I hope that this issue can be sorted out.
customer_reviews.author: garry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect so long as you do not update the software
customer_reviews.text: I used a long usb coonection to my PC, avoid the wifi and updates and you'll be able to use cheaper replacement inks . Been using it for near on a year and all is good. the small screen does have a whinge and tell you that you are not using authorised ink cartridges but just OK that message and it accepts all kinds . No mash ups with paper jams or bleeding colours . 9 out of 10 .
customer_reviews.author: Mr Gadgeteer

customer_reviews.title: Hugely overpriced, inadequate for borderless photo printing.
customer_reviews.text: Useless printer for borderless printing - leaves black marks all over the edges of prints. Tells me that the paper is out of the main cassette when there is over 20 sheets of photo paper left (180gsm, so well within the accepted paper weight advertised, and installed in the correct cartridge, the correct way) Ink lasted less than a day before leaving lines all over my prints. Slow printing photos - do not believe the print speeds advertised. Absolutely not worth the money - my £50 2 year old Canon Pixma was miles better than this!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: cant praise this printer enough.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous printer. .the custom size allowed me to print a landscape photo 5 feet long in the best quality , guzzled up all the ink but sold it at 6 times the cost of the printer. printed my own at a3 and the images are fab on glossy. Advice if you print monochrome..and use glossy paper it will show a blue hue to it.select matte paper in the profile and disable speed printing for truer blacks..the greys still look a bit washed out..but for the price I wouldnt complain loved it
customer_reviews.author: Shinu John

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This 8500 is supposed to be good at pictures - its got 6 inks but it doesn't work too well with greens - looks like mud brown green - I've tried fiddling with all the settings but nothing seems to get proper green colour. It also drives me mad with weird noises - mainly a very high pitch whistle. Turning it off and closing the flappy bits helps...Disappointing experience so far
customer_reviews.author: Thingy

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE DISAPPOINTMENT AFTER 6 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: UTTER RUBBISH - DO NOT BUY!!! After about 6 months use it just refuses to accept any new cartridges. Complete waste of money. Tried customer servic/technnical help and as usual completely failed to help - no-one wants to admit this is a rubbish product and PLEASE DO NOT BUY IT'
customer_reviews.author: Florence319

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer but beware cashback offer
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a decent printer so far, just used if for a few things but great quality. That said, I am comparing it with a 12 year old R200! Too early to comment on things like ink use, but it seems to do a lot & manage to pack it into a relatively small package. Look out for the cashback offer though - I got stung with this one. It doesn't apply if you just buy the printer, you have to buy a multipack of ink and do it at the same time in order to qualify. I didn't feel this was made clear in the offer details on this page.
customer_reviews.author: Aranya

customer_reviews.title: Won't print
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for a couple of months. Suddenly no scan, I contacted support after 4 days 4 different chat people scanner working however printer not. After a week of seeing unable to install driver with the various online people sending me same download THAT DOESN'T WORK. The last guy Alun, said go to microsoft. Now call me silly if you will but if I had the same problem with the scanner and they got it workign wouldn't it seem that it is their problem with printer. About to send it to Epson with my love and buy another company's printer . DON'T TOUCH IT
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B. Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, great prints, very compact .
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why others have found this hard to set up, I'm a 62 yr old woman and I found it easy, takes a little time with the updates but yes it was easy. No problem with the blue transit stickers either, they are easy to find and remove. Synced easily with my laptop so wifi printing is a synch. Print quality is very good as I would expect from Epson. It's early days but right now I am highly delighted I have chosen this model.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Printer failed to print
customer_reviews.text: Once the printer was connected to the PC, and the software and drivers loaded, it failed to print useful output. The results were fuzzy, faint and in the wrong colors. Extensive work with software failed to correct the problem. Printing was then done directly from an SD card inserted into the printer (thus eliminating PC connection), but output was the same. This is not a reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: I-grantha

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer, decided to upgrade from my previous Epson model. Glad I did, not that there was anything wrong with my previous one, but this has lots more functions as well as trays. Spent around 30 minutes setting up various functions and very pleased with quality of photo’s printed. Delivered on time, great product. Epson ink expensive to buy, but if you want good quality you have to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Turner

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is nowhere near that of a Canon. Its Wi-Fi is problematic to set up, and I’m an IT engineer of 30 years’ experience!!!! It has this draw that pops out when printing, but when you’ve finished, stays out ready to be broken!!! You have to push it back in which feels as if your about to damage it. Hence 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Naughton Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality photo reproduction,
customer_reviews.text: Having tested two Ecotank printers and found problems printing photos, it was a relief to finally find an excellent colour printer. The cost of the inks is the only drawback, as is well known.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. L. Margulies

customer_reviews.title: Good print from flexible photo printer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace Epson XP850 to make use of stock of print cartridges. Good print on photo, CD discs and plain printing. Ink cartridges bit small but there are 6. Disappointed that there is not a multiple sheet feeder for photocopying but will print A3 although a bit of a fiddle. But noisy but otherwise happy.
customer_reviews.author: LYN2GO

customer_reviews.title: I was born in 1939 so if I can set it up then you should have no problems what-so-ever !
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like, you remove it from the box, unpack it as instructed. connect it up, as instructed, put the dvd in your p/c, when instructed, & the job is done. No magic or mirrors, just common sense & the ability to read the printed English language . Then don't try to run before you can walk & your only restriction will be your imagination. A word of caution it is not made of solid steel, so treat it as you would be treated. Ray Heath, Aldershot. October 12-2019.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Heath

customer_reviews.title: Epson Is The Best Printer
customer_reviews.text: I love Epson printers , I wanted a printer to replace my previous Epson XP950 , I had to stay with Epson because I had lots of ink cartridges. When I discovered that this is the newer model version , I simply had to purchase it. If It is possible to rate it 20 out of 20 I will. I was only expecting a printer, manual, cd drivers, but I was surprised to find A3 Photo Paper 50 Pack, The Expensive type as well. Thank you Epson. I will put that to good use. Delivery was very quick. The Printer works beautifully, especially for the high spec camera I have.
customer_reviews.author: Emma-Jane Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it - very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I had never bought an Epson printer before, and I never will again. During set-up I had an endless stream of error codes. As soon as one seemed to be resolved, another different one would appear. The casing had very flimsy parts on it too. All in all a total piece of rubbish. I am sending it back for refund will not never buy Epson again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for cd/dvd printing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought primarily for cd/dvd printing but have also used with photo paper and it is really good for photos. Cd/dvd printing is a bit desaturated so have to compensate by increasing saturation on the image.
customer_reviews.author: M. Aust

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Been running this for a few weeks and seams like a great printer ink holding out well very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: N. Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying!
customer_reviews.text: Read before buying! This printer is beyond ridiculous for the price, have had the printer for just over a year now and in the last 3-4 months 70% of whatever the printer prints is blurry, when you’re having to waste 5+ sheets of photo paper before you get a usable print it is beyond stupid, there can’t be any feasible way that the printer can have built up so much gunk in around a year that it would need flushing already. Seems pretty stupid to me that it is marketed as a photo printer and yet printing on photo paper is a no go for it.
customer_reviews.author: JWilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low cost photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but in this case I have to say a big thank you to Epson for producing this excellent printer. I am a long time Epson Photo printer user with my previous Epson R300 lasting many many years. When it finial stopped working I looked around for a replacement and was dubious that £95 would buy a suitable replacement but this XP-8500 delivers a significant improvement. It is not as sturdy but the quality of the prints is fantastic. The speed is fantastic. It very good.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kench

customer_reviews.title: Amazing print quality
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer. I have been using it for a couple of months for my business and it prints beautifully. It does use a lot of ink, but I think it is worth it. I previously used an entry-level ecotank and found this a fantastic step-up, especially at this price point. I also love the rear paper feeder that can take heavy weight paper and A3.
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Fine if you have a paper loading fetish.
customer_reviews.text: Had high expectations for this printer. Ended up returning it after a week as it would print one page then eject 4 to 6 blank pages then clog itself up with paper and then give me a paper jam message. Unusable. It also felt a little fragile and I couldn't see it lasting very long. Print quality was good. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Lampwick

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: A great printer. Printed a3 photopaper and 4x6 photo paper along with standard a4 plain paper. Great results. The only critisim is you can only load 1 sheet of a3 at a time. Apart from that a great peice of kit. Linked to the families android phones and laptops. Havent tried the cd print yet. But will soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Doing a great job for me. Touch screen got 4 because I tend to miss-hit due to arthritically bent fingers. Still finding out all it can do. Photographs very clear and good colour.
customer_reviews.author: Trendyvice

customer_reviews.title: Awful to install and connect
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read up about this printer. I have always brought epson printers and this printer is the most difficult to install. The quality does not meet my expectation. I should have returned this within the returns window. Would not recommend. It won't connect to my computer despite reading up on this. Wireless function very poor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Horrible experience. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible printer. Unacceptable quality on standard and thicker paper. Very greedy on ink. Pain in the arse to set up, swap inks etc. Damn thing has a mind of it's own. Tells you to swap 3 inks. So you change 3 inks, the other 3 are fine. Then when you go to print.... what do you know, all of a sudden the other 3 need changing straight after. Then when you swap them with expensive Epson cartridges it tells you.... printer can't recognize your ink cartridges. Grrrrr. Thankfully we also have the smaller XP-830 which has been a much more reliable machine.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Jim

customer_reviews.title: As you would expect from Epson
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of getting used to. The printer is excellent, the operator fell short on first lot of photo's printed. Just remember to tell the printer what type of paper is being loaded. You can set the printer for high quality photo's but that's no use if the printer thinks it's printing to plain paper.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Shorten

customer_reviews.title: This is real value for money and the print quality is very good. I almost bought a Canon printer after some ...
customer_reviews.text: My previous Epson printer had lasted since 2003 but finally gave up the ghost and I wanted a printer that would print up to A3 and print CD's. This is real value for money and the print quality is very good. I almost bought a Canon printer after some research but opted for the Epson because of the years of service gained from my old 9600 which believe succumbed through using some cheap non manufacturers cartridges; my advice is don't do it, not worth it in the long run. Although loading CD's and A3 paper is a bit fiddly for the price and quality of results it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: Great when you have it working
customer_reviews.text: Setup is convoluted, confusing and takes ages. Had to delete and start again on Windows 7 laptop. Once it is fully set up it is an extremely versatile device for printing and scanning by USB, or remotely by wifi. This is just a first impression as not used much yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Peter Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive bit of kit "out of the box".
customer_reviews.text: Early days, since it is new to me, so I can't comment on reliability, robustness nor ink consumption, but out of the box, it is compact, stylish, and prints well from all three paper trays, scans and copies very well. It was easy to set up on my network, and works with i-print, too. It's quite quiet in operation, too. It's early days, but I'm very impressed at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Cass

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer....... but !!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've found this printer to be excellent in its function, styling etc. and produces excellent photo prints. However, I'm just a little perturbed at the high price of the genuine Epson inkjet cartridges which I was not made aware of at the time of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace our previous Epson. I did have to ask my son to install the drivers etc and connect , which took a while. However very pleased with the quality . It’s stylish and compact .
customer_reviews.author: Shazzie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality prints
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fab! The print quality is amazing as long as you use decent paper.. but there is no comparison to my old printer. I’m very pleased with it so far although I don’t know how expensive the ink will be depending on my usage.. but overall on first usage/impressions, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good
customer_reviews.text: As a semi-professional photographer I needed a smaller printer after my Epson 3880 ceased working. I read the reviews of this printer but was still dubious it would be as good as they said especially as it does not use profiles. It is great colour prints match my files perfectly and monochrome ones are cast free.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Allsopp

customer_reviews.title: Returned it...
customer_reviews.text: The printer made a continual buzzing even on idle... It wasn't very loud but because it sits next to me in the office it was very noticeable and really annoying. Real shame... Other than that it's small and does what it's supposed to do. I'm hoping it was a one off issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Giles

customer_reviews.title: Epson Expression Photo Printer XP-96-
customer_reviews.text: Epson have always been my preferred printer of choice for photo printing. I have had many models over the years and each one is an improvement over the previous model. However, this may well be the exception to the rule. The prints are still very very good. I feel the build quality is not as good as in previous models. The paper trays are flimsy to say the least. I have yet to try the A3 facility. Good in some ways disappointing in others.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Good quality photo prints
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this printer for about a week now. It was relatively easy to set up to both my desktop (wired) and laptop (wifi) computers. Have printed on A4, 7x5 and 6x4 glossy photo papers and delighted with the results. Have not yet tried the rear entry A3 paper port yet (and that is what I mainly bought the printer for!). Pleased with the speed of printing (faster than by Brother printer/copier).
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Epson Expression 8500 printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, but head blocked after two weeks, tried cleaning a few times on different days couldn't clear it so sent it back, shame because otherwise a good printer
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and vibrant printing in colour, very easy to use. It’s handy that the printer tray opens and closes automatically as it makes the device look neat and keeps everything very tidy. The ink consumption rate is also economical.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a versatile quality printer?
customer_reviews.text: Needed an update to replace a printer for photos. A little more complex than the norm to set up - you need to specify exactly the size and quality of the paper for example - but what flexibility, and what quality!! for photos using the new (new to me) enduring inks. Super buy and at this price. Thank you amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Satis

customer_reviews.title: Great photo quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a super printer,print quality for photos very good. Plain paper printing was average, I have found HP photo printers perform better on plain paper but not as good for photos as the Epson. Unfortunately after only 2 years an error appeared which despite much searching was unable to fix. As is with most home printers I was not able to find anyone to repair it or even quote for a repair. So sadly it has been confined to the recycle center and been replaced with the updated xp-670 model. I hope that lasts a bit longer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design stupid installing software
customer_reviews.text: If they where paid to make it an ordeal to or impossible to installing it , they will never ever do a better job So hard so complicate so stupid to setup this dam-it printers Never Epson printers again
customer_reviews.author: mofreh sarhan

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this impressive, clever machine.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get used to the fact that there are multiple paper trays, this works like a dream. It's particularly good at picking up the print signal from Android phones,making the printing operation as quick and easy as it possibly can be.
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Great A3 printer
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer I wanted a printer that could print A3 photos, this is a fabulous printer and the quality is brilliant and been wireless I can print from any device attached or not. The only downside is if it’s not used regularly the head cleaning process wastes a fair amount of ink but that’s an epson flaw and one I’m used too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Settle

customer_reviews.title: What You See on the Screen is What You Get from this Printer
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for in terms of quality. I usually buy HP but decided to branch out in A3 terms and bought this printer with some trepidation. After I calibrated it with my PC and editing software the results are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Yelmotton

customer_reviews.title: Very good picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: It performs its various functions very well. The cassette paper tray No2 could carry more paper for every day office use. A3 colour prints very good. Too early to comment on ink usage. All printer manufacturers make their margins on the High price inks, however the printer is very good value for money and its diversity.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Richard & Jennifer S. D. White

customer_reviews.title: Great photo printer
customer_reviews.text: If photo printing is the main purpose then this is a great printer. Ink is not cheap but the quality far outshines cheaper models. One good thing with Epson is you can use non branded inks, a real bonus.
customer_reviews.author: WengaBoy

customer_reviews.title: OK printer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best printer I've owned but pretty good. If only Epson would get real about the price of their inks!
customer_reviews.author: sydney james

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, shame about the networking.
customer_reviews.text: Was not able to remain connected to the wireless network for more than 24hrs. Cloud print was rendered useless as you had to be there to turn the printer off and on again to get it to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I would'nt be with out it must have
customer_reviews.text: Very nice printer works installed very well from the computer i was disapointed there was no usb cable lead came with the printer in the box i had to take my usb printer cabel lead off my other printer Epson RX700 all in one, best printer i ever had it was was a brilliant printer i had it for years then suddly i had problems with it and parts for it discontinued to fix the problem then i was told to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. B. Steed

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Compared with my old Epson printers have come a long way. The fact that it's front loading is a godsend. Would recommend you buy the cheaper inks from amazon to run it. WiFi connectivity is good. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: JMW1

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it. Super easy to use and replace cartriges! Amazing quality prints!
customer_reviews.author: Justina

customer_reviews.title: Great printer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer easy to use and set up. I use the 1st tray for plain paper, the second for 7X5 photo paper for proofs and snapshots I find the rear feed great even though it is only single sheet. I can do A3 and A4. easily. It is no disadvantage to me to only print single A3 sheets. I can't afford too many A3 proof prints.
customer_reviews.author: Glyn Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this as it had all the specs he wanted. I'm a total tech phobe and even I can use this, it's simple and does the job. There's really nothing to dislike about it
customer_reviews.author: Kazzy&Darren

customer_reviews.title: Prefer to give no stars for print quality !!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing as it looked a nice machine and much smaller than my old one. It’s just a shame the printer wouldn’t pick up the paper no matter how much I tried !! So it’s about as useful as an inflatable dartboard.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Heath

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic printer get extra inks elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic would be five star easily but i bought this with ink and extra set of xl inks and the amount of ink in both sets only printed nine beautiful pictures hope i just got 2 sets of very very bad ink as printer is a fantastic upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Glancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: A good all round printer. Photo quality is reasonable but the colour match with the screen is not great and the prints come out darker than expected . One of the reasons for choosing it was the availability of 3rd party ink cartridges at reasonable prices and they work well.
customer_reviews.author: David Torrens

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer and value for money. We wanted to print the occasional photo and this provides a good quality print.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an earlier Epson photo printer - I like the smaller size but it still delivers the functionality I want. Dual paper trays, quality photo printing and scanner. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Scaife

customer_reviews.title: Buy one - you'll love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic printer - works a dream straight off iPhone over wi-fi with 7" x 5" prints - photo quality. Also lets you print multiple photos onto one page.
customer_reviews.author: Postie40

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: What a difficult product to install, once it was up and running it was fantastic. Paper trays a bit sticky. I would recommend this to anyone with two 15 year old Technophobes....
customer_reviews.author: Maggi Guccianni

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: quiet, easy to use, compact and neat. flip control panel doesn't always lock back when off & closing up but not a real issue re where printer is placed in room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not have Ethernet port but WiFi works reliably.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, fast, and decent print quality. Scanner for usual docs is surprisingly good too. Sadly, despite the info on amazons website, it does not have Ethernet/Rj45 connector.
customer_reviews.author: Pawel R.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality printer
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality printer. Highly recommend. Does all I need and more. Some say do not use for every day printing. If the ink can be bought at a reasonable price I don't see why not. Only comment from her in doors is when using rear feed, which is designed for thicker paper, you can only print one page at a time. No problem! Alan
customer_reviews.author: Alan Riches

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was very easy to set up and get going, even for me. It gives nice coloured copies and crisp black and white text. I can scan, copy and print on paper or photo. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Pauline M. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this printer. I needed certain specifications and this printer fulfilled all that I needed. Great printer at a great price. Printing quality excellent for photos and other craft / artistic projects. Also fantastic with WiFi and so easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Poor Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to write this, but after about 15 months (just outside the warranty period), the printer would not pick up the paper in the tray. I kept getting the message "ray out of paper." I expected a few years reliable service from this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Ward

product_meta.title: Epson C11CE22301BX SureColor SC-P800 A2 Colour Photo Inkjet Printer
product_meta.description:
Size Name:SC-P800| Style Name:Without Ink MultipackStandard tray media types: Photo paper, Plain paper, Roll, ISO A-series sizes (A0...A9): A2, A3, A3+, A4, A5, A6, ISO B-series sizes (B0...B9): B3, B4, B5, B6. Standard interfaces: USB

BOX CONTAINS
1 x Epson SureColor SC-P800 - 17" large-format printer - colour - ink-jet - Roll (43.2 cm) - 2880 x 1440 dpi - up to 3 ppm (mono) / up to 3 ppm (colour) - capacity: 120 sheets - USB 2.0, LAN, Wi-Fi(n)
feature_bullets: Maximum resolution: 2880 x 1440 DPI. Print speed (black, normal quality, A4/US Letter): 3 ppm, Print speed (colour, normal quality, A4/US Letter): 3 ppm
Printing colours: Cyan, Light black, Light cyan, Light black, Light magenta, Matte black, Photo black, Vivid mag, Paper input type: Manual, Paper tray, Roll

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars521 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
